title: Sectional Mock 4 - English
instruction: In the following passage, there are blanks each of which has been numbered. These numbers correspond to the question numbers; against each question, five words have been suggested, one of which fills the blank appropriately.Sport is expected to ____ (A) ____ at a higher moral plane where the effort is honest and transparency remains an abiding principle. It is a utopian ideal ____ (B) ____ on pure performance, copious sweat and relentless training. But in a practical world greased with greed, besides match-fixing, there is another terrible ____ (C) ____ : ingestion of performance-enhancing drugs. Athletes like Canada’s Ben Johnson were labelled as drug-cheats and rightly ____ (D) ____ their Olympic medals. The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA), since its inception in 1999, has ____ (E) ____ stringent measures so that sport stays drug-free. In India, WADA’s rules have been ____ (F) ____ by the Government-run National Anti-Doping Agency (NADA) and almost all sports federations had fallen in line except one behemoth — the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI). But that aberration was ____ (G) ____ as the BCCI accepted NADA’s supervision following a meeting between its CEO Rahul Johri, General Manager Saba Karim and Sports Ministry officials led by Sports Secretary Radhey Shyam Julaniya.

quiz.text: That residents are now given minimum piped water and meagre tanker (A) / supplies totalled a third of the installed capacity of 1,494 million litres a day, (B) / that too mainly from desalination plants, faraway lakes and (C) / farm wells, is proof of the neglect of water governance. (D) / No error (E)
options: That residents are now given minimum piped water and meagre tanker
supplies totalled a third of the installed capacity of 1,494 million litres a day,
that too mainly from desalination plants, faraway lakes and
farm wells, is proof of the neglect of water governance.
No error

quiz.text: RBI has raised (A) / misgivings (B) / about Mudra loans (C) / turning non-performing. (D) / No error (E)
options: RBI has raised
misgivings
about Mudra loans
turning non-performing.
No error

quiz.text: Many of my cousins beat (A) / around the bushes (B) / quite a bit, especially when they have (C) / to give you bad news. (D) / No error (E)
options: Many of my cousins beat
around the bushes
quite a bit, especially when they have
to give you bad news.
No error

quiz.text: The Bombay High Court on Thursday upheld (A) / the constitutional validity of (B) / reservation of the Maratha community (C) / in government jobs and education. (D) / No error (E)
options: The Bombay High Court on Thursday upheld
the constitutional validity of
reservation of the Maratha community
in government jobs and education.
No error

quiz.text: Which of the following is/are synonyms of 'sanguinary'? I. MurderousII. GoryIII. BarbaricIV. Ruthless
options: Only I and II
Only I, II and IV
Only II, III and IV
Only I, III and IV
All of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is/are synonyms of 'Nihilism'? I. AnarchyII. AtheismIII. RatificationIV. Optimism
options: Only II
Only II and IV
Only II and III
Only I and III
Only I, II and III

quiz.text: Which of the following is/are synonyms of 'proselytize'? I. AcceptII. AttackIII. UpholdIV. Espouse
options: Only I and III
Only II and IV
Only I, II and IV
Only I, III and IV
Only II, III and IV

quiz.text: Which of the following is/are true with respect to the passage? I. Islamic State leans towards “nihilism” of Sayyid Qutb.II. Pakistan provides support to terror outfits such as the Lashkar-e-Taiba.III. The terror attack on a mosque in North Sinai, Egypt in November this year, which killed over 230 persons, is an example of new radicalism.
options: Only I
Only I and II
Only II and III
Only I and III
All of the above

quiz.text: As per paragraph 4, which of the following is true with respect to earlier methodologies adopted by terror outfits? I. Such methods are no longer followed.II. Such methods are as effective as the newer ones.III. Such methods are followed by upcoming groups in various countries
options: Only II
Only III
Only I and II
Only II and III
All of the above

quiz.text: As per paragraph 1, which of the following is true about the new generation of terrorists?
options: They are an extension of the earlier radical Islamist terrorists influenced by preachers.
They believe a lot more in ideology.
They do not believe so much in ideology.
They are more violent and aggressive than the earlier radical Islamist terrorists.
None of the above

quiz.text: As per paragraph 3, which of the terror networks are matched correctly with the countries they’re most active in? I. Haqqani network – AfghanistanII. Lashkar-e-Jhangvi – BangladeshIII. Boko Haram – Africa
options: Only III
Only I
Only II and III
Only I and III
Only I and II

quiz.text: As per paragraph 2, what are the distinguishing features of IS which differentiate is from other radical Islamist groups? I. Extreme violenceII. NihilismIII. Online recruitment
options: only I
only II
only I and III
only II and III
All of the above

quiz.text: Defying sceptics who warned that it would turn out to be a millstone around banks’ necks, the NDA’s Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana (PMJDY) _______________. I. has helped the government rein in inflation in the countryII. is a scheme that has stood the test of time so that it can become profitable for the governmentIII. seems to be delivering well on its financial inclusion objectives
options: Both I and III
Only III
Both II and III
Both I and II
All I, II and III

quiz.text: The amount of pension and rules vary on the basis of years of service of an employee and nature of retirement, _______________. I. be it voluntary or after reaching age of superannuation, among othersII. i.e. it should be natural retirement only and not voluntary retirementIII. and the amount of hard work put by others during the career
options: Both II and III
Both I and III
Both I and II
Only III
All I, II and III

quiz.text: _______________ such as the bankruptcy code and GST has failed to keep growth going in a period of benign commodity prices. I. The government that has introduced progressive reformsII. It is ironic that a government that introduced sweeping reformsIII. The parliament could not hold the moves
options: Only III
Both I and III
Both II and III
Both I and II
None of I, II and III

quiz.text: The consultation paper floated by the two leading stock exchanges has renewed the debate about the heavy tilt in the listed stocks universe towards a few sectors _______________. I. and the inability of the Indian stock exchange to act as a mirror of the economyII. making it difficult for the indices to reflect the true picture of the Indian economyIII. which distort the weightage of the various sectors in the Indian economy
options: Both II and III
Both I and III
Both I and II
All I, II and III
None of I, II and III

quiz.text: The auto sector has been _______________ pollution and the need to switch over to electric vehicles (EVs) over the next decade, occupying the centre-stage. I. understanding the effect of pollution on the health of the human beingsII. downward due to the fact that the government is not able to containIII. skyrocketing in the recent years without any proper background story
options: Only III
Only II
Both II and III
All I, II and III
None of I, II and III

quiz.text: Delhi and Mumbai are tinderbox cities and therefore must strengthen their respective fire and safety regulations.
options: Full of inflammable waste
Extremely crowded
Dangerously uncontrollable
Readily ignited
None of the above

quiz.text: The situation was already tense, but the fat hit the fire when she was accused of embezzling funds as well.
options: Disapprove
Deteriorate
Troubled
Widen
None of the above

quiz.text: The customer gave a mouthful when asked the reason for his dissatisfaction.
options: Angry
Verbose
Succinct
Loud
None of the above

quiz.text: When the new intern walked in dressed casually in jeans, there were a lot of raised eyebrows.
options: Regret
Enthusiasm
Disapproval
Questions
None of the above

quiz.text: Whether the temperature rise was mainly due to the greenhouse effect was a moot point.
options: Certain
Scheme
Regular
Disputed
None of the above

quiz.text: The company tried to keep a lid on the lawsuit but word got out to the media.
options: Control
Conform
Recover
Defeat
None of the above

quiz.text: A
options: operate
terminate
trade
fail
defile

quiz.text: Ba] learning
options: leaning
fascinating
terming
easing

quiz.text: C
options: offence
determination
offer
status
tragedy

quiz.text: D
options: divided
denied
rejected
felicitated
rained

quiz.text: E
options: imposed
intrigued
traded
intended
none of these

quiz.text: F
options: entrusted
enforced
derided
fractioned
utilised

quiz.text: G
options: earned
erased
standard
studied
accused
